data.title: Projects A-Z
data.text:
30th Street Station Redevelopment, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

30th Street Station, a 100-year-old railway station in Philadelphia, US, and Amtrak's third-busiest station, is planned to be redeveloped to improve customer experience. It serves over four million Amtrak customers and more than eight million Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority (SEPTA) and NJ TRANSIT railway commuters annually.

75th Street Corridor Improvement Project, Chicago

The 75th Street Corridor Improvement Project is aimed at enhancing freight and passenger rail service along the rail corridor in the City of Chicago, US.

95th Street Terminal Improvement Project, Chicago

Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) is reconstructing the 95th Street Terminal that serves as the southern terminal station for Red Line, CTA's busiest rail line in the Chicago, US.

Škoda 28 T Tramcar

Škoda Transportation, a Czech-based company engaged in transport engineering, launched its first 100% low-floor bi-directional five-section tramcar 28 T in October 2013 for the city of Konya in Turkey.

Aarhus Light Rail Project, Aarhus

Aarhus Light Rail Project or Aarhus Letbane is the first light rail project in Denmark. Construction on the project was started in June 2013 and completed in December 2017. The first phase of the light rail project involves 110km of light rail line serving 51 stops in the Aarhus area.

Abbey Wood Station Redevelopment, London, UK

Abbey Wood railway station on the Elizabeth Line was rebuilt and opened in 2017 to accommodate new Crossrail services.

Aberdeen to Inverness Rail Improvement Project

A project to improve the railway line between Aberdeen and Inverness, was approved by Transport Scotland, the national transport agency of Scotland, in March 2014.

Abidjan Metro, Ivory Coast

Abidjan Metro, also known as Metro d’Abidjan, is a 37km-long elevated rapid transit network being developed by French companies in coordination with the Ivory Coast Government to address traffic congestion in the city of Abidjan.

Abuja Light Rail System

Abuja Light Rail System is a new light rail network being developed in Abuja, the capital city of Nigeria.

Abuja-Kaduna Rail Line

The Abuja-Kaduna rail line is one of the first standard gauge railway modernisation projects (SGRMP) undertaken in Nigeria, the most populous country in Africa.

Accra-Tema Railway Line

The 24km Accra-Tema rail line is located between Accra, the capital city of Ghana, and Tema a city in the Greater Acc

ACELA High-Speed Rail Network System

A commercial and political powerhouse, America's Northeast Corridor (NEC) is one of the most densely populated areas of

Agra Metro Rail Project, Uttar Pradesh, India

The Agra Metro will have two lines with an estimated ridership of 870,000 passengers a day in 2041.

Ahmedabad Metro Rail, Gujarat, India

Ahmedabad Metro is a new rapid transit system under construction between Gandhinagar and Ahmedabad in the state of Gujarat, India.

Airdrie-Bathgate Railway Link, United Kingdom

The Airdrie-Bathgate Railway Link connects Edinburgh to Glasgow through Bathgate, Drumgelloch and Airdrie. It was opened

AirTrain Newark Replacement Program, New Jersey, US

The AirTrain Newark Replacement Program is expected to commence commercial operations in 2029.

Al Mashaaer Al Mugaddassah Metro Project, Saudi Arabia

The Al Mashaaer Al Mugaddassah Metro Line (MMMP), which is part of the Makkah (Mecca) Metro, is an 18.1km line constructed to connect the holy cities of Mecca, Arafat, Muzdalifa and Mina. The line was opened in November 2010 and became fully operational in November 2011.

Alaris Tilting Trains

The Spanish Railways' (RENFE) summer 1999 timetable marked the introduction of the first tilting trains on the busy rout

Alaska-Alberta (A2A) Rail Corridor

Alaska-Alberta (A2A) rail corridor is a proposed rail network that will connect the US state of Alaska with Alberta, Canada. The route will link the deep-water ports and the existing railway network of Alaska to the Canadian railway system.

Albabstieg (Gerlinde) Railway Tunnel

The Albabstieg tunnel, christened as Gerlinde tunnel, is a 5.9km railway tunnel under construction on the new Wendlingen-Ulm line in Germany.

Algiers Metro

Algiers Metro was inaugurated on 31 October 2011 after nearly three decades of development. It is Algeria's first metro system and the second metro transport system in Africa.

Alicante Tram-Train, Operated by Ferrocarriles de la Generalitat Valenciana, Spain

Alicante and the surrounding region is a major tourist destination in south-east Spain with many popular resorts, includ

Alice Springs-Darwin Rail Line Construction, Northern Territory, Australia

Envisaged in 1911 with the creation of the Northern Territories, the 1,420km (880-mile) line between Alice Springs and Darwin in Australia's Northern Territory was completed on 17 September 2003.

All Aboard Florida High-Speed Rail Project

All Aboard Florida is a 235-mile (378km) high-speed intercity passenger rail project being developed by Florida East Coast Industries (FECI) to connect Miami in South Florida with Orlando in Central Florida, US.

Almaty Metro

Almaty Metro is the first metropolitan railway or rapid transit system of Kazakhstan. It is the second metro system to be opened in Central Asia.

Alstom AGV Very High Speed Trains

Automotrice Grande Vitesse (AGV) is an advanced very high speed train designed and developed by Alstom. It is claimed to be the most eco-friendly railcar in the world.

Alstom Coradia Regional Trains

The Coradia family of regional trains, manufactured by Alstom Transport, are high-performance rolling stock offered in various configurations suitable for diverse requirements.

Alstom Coradia Stream Regional Trains, France

Alstom's Coradia Stream has been ordered by multiple countries including Italy, Denmark, Germany, and the Netherlands.

Alstom Euroduplex Very High Speed Train

Euroduplex is the third generation of TGV (Train à Grande Vitesse) very high speed trains being manufactured by Alstom.

Alstom Metropolis Trains

Manufactured by Alstom, the Metropolis trains are flexible and reliable high-tech rolling stock, which will serve 22 major cities, including New York, Paris, Barcelona, Amsterdam, London, Chennai and Singapore.

Alstom Régiolis Regional Trains

Régiolis is a next-generation regional train developed by Alstom Transport. The train is derived from Coradia Polyvalent regional trains. The new trains aim to offer reliability and comfort for passengers, while delivering low operational costs.

Alstom X’Trapolis Mega Suburban Train

Produced by Alstom Transport, X'trapolis is a high-capacity train specifically designed for suburban and regional transport.

Alstom’s Citadis Trams, France

Alstom’s Citadis low-floor trams are operating in more than 20 countries.

AlUla Tramway, Saudi Arabia

The infrastructure work on the 22.4km first phase of the tramway is scheduled to begin in 2024.

Amsterdam Metro / Light Rail Network by GVB

The largest single order for new-generation light rail vehicles was placed by the city of Amsterdam, Netherlands, as part of a major exercise to replace its antiquated fleet of 234 trams, which have become increasingly unreliable.

Amsterdam Metro North-South Line

Dutch capital Amsterdam is midway through the Noord-Zuidlijn construction project, a new north-south metro line. To be d

Amsterdam Zuid Station Expansion

Amsterdam Zuid Station is located in the borough of Amsterdam-Zuid in Amsterdam, Netherlands.

Amtrak Cities Sprinter (ACS-64) Locomotive

Amtrak Cities Sprinter (ACS-64) is an advanced electric locomotive designed and built by Siemens for the US passenger rail operator Amtrak.

Amtrak’s Northeast Corridor

The Northeast Corridor (NEC) is a 457-mile (735.5km) railway line connecting highly urbanised areas in the US.

Amtrak’s Airo Passenger Train, USA

The Amtrak Airo™ trains are being developed by Siemens Mobility for Amtrak to improve passenger comfort and efficiency.

Angermunde-Szczecin Railway Line Upgrade, Germany

The Angermunde-Szczecin railway line in Germany is being upgraded to enable faster operating speeds.

Angers Light Rail System – Light Rail Revolution

Like the Valenciennes system opened in 2007, Angers in the Pays de la Loire region of north western France is indicative

Ankara Metro

Ankara, the Turkish capital, first devised a project to build a light rail metro system in 1987, and was able to take ad

Ankara-Istanbul High-Speed Train Project

Turkish Railways (TCDD) has constructed the country's first high-speed railway line, which connects the capital city of Ankara with largest population centre of Istanbul, and serves more than 17 million people.

Ankara-Izmir High-Speed Railway Project, Turkey

The Ankara-Izmir HSR is a key national project of the Turkish Government’s Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure.

Ankara-Sivas High-Speed Line

The 406km-long Ankara-Sivas high-speed line is being developed by the Turkish State Railways (TCDD) between Ankara and Sivas in Turkey.

Antwerpen Centraal and North South Junction

With similarities to the Berlin Hauptbahnhof and north-south tunnel developments opened in 2006, the Belgian city of Ant

Anzac Station, Victoria

The new Anzac Station, owned by the Australian Victorian Government via state-owned enterprise VicTrack, is being built in Victoria, Australia.

Argentine High-Speed Railway

Passenger rail travel in Argentina is a limited commodity. Privatisation resulted in the removal of many of the country's passenger trains.

Arlanda Express High Speed Rail Link operated by A-Train AB, Sweden

24 November 1999 saw the inauguration of the new, dedicated high-speed rail link between Stockholm Central railway station and the city's main airport, at Arlanda. The airport is at a competitive disadvantage over other major city air terminals, as it is 42km (26 miles) from the city centre.

Arna-Bergen Railway Line

The single-track Arna-Bergen railway line in Norway is being converted into a double-track route to facilitate increased speed and more flexible traffic evolution.

Ashley Down Railway Station, Bristol, UK

Ashley Down railway station is the first of three new stations planned to be built as part of the wider MetroWest Phase 2 project.

Astana Nurly Zhol Railway Station

In June 2015, the concept of a new railway station near Mynzhyldyk Alley in Astana, Kazakhstan, was approved by the Department of Architecture and Urban Planning in Astana.

AT-200 Commuter Train

AT-200 is a modular electric commuter train launched by Hitachi Rail Europe in London in July 2014.

Athens Metro

The Athens Metro in Greece is formed of an enlarged and upgraded suburban rail route, as well as two newer lines.

Athens Trams Project in Greece by Sirio LRV

Athens’ tram system had closed by 1960 in the belief that the private car, taxis and buses could cater for the exp

Atlanta Metro Rail Project

The Atlanta Metro Rail Project is the largest public works project undertaken in Southeast US to date. It consists of fo

Atlanta Streetcar Project, Georgia

The first phase of the Atlanta Streetcar project stretching between Centennial Olympic Park and the Martin Luther King Jr Historical Site in downtown Atlanta, Georgia, US, was officially opened in December 2014.

Atocha Railway Station

The Atocha Railway Station is the first to be built in Madrid. Located in the district of Prado near the centre of Mad

Auckland Light Rail Project

The Auckland Light Rail project is a proposed light rail network to be built in Auckland, New Zealand.

Auckland Rapid Transit System

With just four million people (estimated to be 4.3 million in 2010) in a landmass roughly the same size as Great Britain

AVE

Having first sanctioned a 160km/h (100mph) maximum speed as recently as 1986, Spain moved quickly to get high-speed rail

Avenio M Trams

Avenio M is the latest variant in the Avenio family of light rail vehicles (LRVs) manufactured by Siemens.

Avignon Tramway, Provence

The Community of Greater Avignon (Communauté d’Agglomération du Grand Avignon) began construction on a tramway project in Avignon, a commune in Provence region in south-east France, in October 2016.

Awash Woldia / Hara Gebeya Railway Line Project

The Awash Woldia/Hara Gebeya Railway Project is a new railway line being constructed between Awash and Woldia, Ethiopia.

Bahn 2000

In the 1980s, rail corridors through the Swiss Alps were running near capacity, and traffic connections in the densely p

Bahrain Metro Project, Kingdom of Bahrain

The Bahrain metro is a rail-based urban transportation system with a passenger capacity of approximately 43,000 an hour.

Bakerloo Line Extension, London

The Bakerloo Line extension project is a proposed expansion of the London Underground Bakerloo line from its existing terminal station at Elephant & Castle to Lewisham, via Old Kent Road and New Cross Gate, in the UK.

Baku-Tbilisi-Kars (BTK) Rail Line, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Turkey

Baku-Tbilisi-Kars (BTK) railway line is a regional railway link that will directly connect Kars in Turkey, Tbilisi in Georgia and Baku in Azerbaijan.

Ballarat Line Upgrade, Melbourne

The upgrading of the Ballarat Line, operating between Melbourne and the Ballarat city in Victoria, commenced in October 2017. The upgrade was completed in January 2021.

Baltimore & Potomac (B&P) Tunnel Replacement Project, Maryland, US

The Baltimore and Potomac Tunnel Project will replace the 2.25km-long rail tunnel on the Northeast Corridor in Baltimore, Maryland, US.

Baltimore Penn Station Redevelopment Project, Baltimore, Maryland, USA

Baltimore Penn Station serves more than three million Amtrak and Maryland Area Rail Commuter (MARC) passengers a year.

Baltimore Red Line, Maryland

The Baltimore Red Line is a 14.1 mile (22.7km) east-west light rail transit (LRT) line proposed by the Maryland Transit Administration (MTA) that will run from Woodlawn in suburban Baltimore County to Bayview in east Baltimore City.

Baltimore Subway and Light Rail System

The US city of Baltimore’s Metro Subway and Light Rail System (LRS) are operated by the Maryland Transit Administr

Bangalore High-Speed Rail Link

The Bangalore high-speed rail link (HSRL) project is being undertaken by the Government of Karnataka to connect the ci

Bangkok Mass Rapid Transit-Green Line Extension

Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) is expanding Bangkok’s Green Line in two directions. The existing Green Line, also known as the Sukhumvit Line, is an elevated rail line from Mo Chit in the Chatuchak District to Bearing in Bang Na District of Bangkok.

Bangkok Mass Rapid Transit-Purple Line

The Purple Line is a 23km long mass rapid heavy rail system that will connect Tao Bang Yai in the north-western suburbs

Bangkok Metro

Bangkok Metro is the underground metro rail system of Bangkok city in Thailand. It is officially known as the Mass Rapid

Bangkok Transit System Light Rail Route Extension

In an effort to provide a long-term solution to road congestion, Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) initiated studies on three separate mass transit systems during the late 20th century.

Bank Station Capacity Upgrade Project, London, UK

The capacity of the Bank Station has increased by 40% following the completion of a major upgrade.

Bankstown Line Upgrade, Sydney

The Bankstown line between Sydenham and Bankstown in Sydney, Australia, is being upgraded to metro rail standards.

Barangaroo Station, Sydney

Barangaroo Station is a new underground metro station being built to serve for the inner-city Barangaroo precinct in Sydney, Australia.

Barcelona

Boosted by hosting the 1992 Olympic Games, Barcelona on Spain's north-east coast has continued to grow in reputation and

Barcelona Metro Line 9

Barcelona Metro Line 9 is set to become the longest automated metro line in Europe when construction work concludes in 2014.

BART Silicon Valley Berryessa Extension Project

Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) Silicon Valley is a planned 16-mile extension of the existing BART regional heavy rail system to San Jose, Milpitas and Santa Clara, California, US.

BART Warm Springs Extension, California

San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) system is being extended by 5.4 miles (8.69km) from the existing Fremont Station south to a new station called Warm Springs / South Fremont station in the Warm Springs District in Fremont, California, US.

BART’s Fleet of the Future Project, San Francisco

San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit District (BART) will replace its fleet of existing 669 rail cars, which are the oldest in the country, with 775 new rail cars under a project known as the Fleet of the Future.

Basque Y High Speed Rail Network

Basque Y (also known as Y Vasca) is a 172km-long high speed network currently under construction in Spain. Basque Y will connect the three capitals in the Basque Autonomous Region, Bilbao, Vitoria and San Sebastián, and will transport both goods and passengers.

Bayside Rail Project

The 42.7km Frankston railway line connecting Melbourne city centre with the south-eastern suburban city of Frankston is undergoing a $100m upgrade, known as the Bayside Rail Project, to improve reliability, safety and capacity along the line.

Bayswater Station Upgrade, Perth

Bayswater Station located on the Midland Line in Perth, Western Australia, will undergo a major transformation as a part of the METRONET programme of the Western Australia Government.

Beaulieu Park Station, Chelmsford, England, UK

The new Beaulieu Park station is a vital component of Chelmsford's sustainable transportation strategy.

Beerburrum to Nambour Rail Upgrade Project, Queensland, Australia

The project is being funded via a 70/30 ratio between the Australian Government and Queensland state government.

Beijing Fengtai Railway Station, China

The Beijing Fengtai Railway Station project involved the reconstruction of a station that operated for more than 100 years.

Beijing Olympic Village Rail Link Construction

The 2008 Olympic Games led to a huge investment in transport systems throughout China's capital city Beijing. As the tra

Beijing West Railway Station, Beijing

Built on 51ha and measuring 510,000m², the Beijing West Railway Station was the largest railway station in Asia unt

Beijing’s Metro, Beijing Subway Development

Beijing's metro was approved in 1965 and had a first line of 24km, primarily motivated by military considerations. It was the first line in China and opened on 1 October 1969.

Beijing-Guangzhou High-Speed Railway Line, China

China has crossed another milestone in its high-speed railway network, with the inauguration of the Beijing-Guangzhou high-speed railway line in December 2012.

Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Line

The 1,318km Beijing-Shanghai high-speed line connects the cities of Beijing, Shanghai and Tianjin, travelling across the provinces of Hebei, Shandong, Anhui and Jiangsu.

Beijing-Tianjin – High-Speed Commuter Link in China

China's railway system has been going through a massive phase of upgrading and expansion under the Chinese Ministry of R

Belfast Grand Central Station, Belfast, Ireland

Belfast Grand Central Station is an integrated bus and railway station being developed in Belfast city, Ireland.

Belgian High Speed Line Network

Principal administrative centre for the European Union, the Belgian capital of Brussels is also the focal point for a hi

Belgrade Light Metro, Serbia

Belgrade Light Metro, also known as BELAM, is a light rail transit system under development in Belgrade, Serbia. The €1bn project is a part of the Urban Master Plan of Belgrade 2021.

Belgrade-Budapest Railway Project, Europe

The Budapest-Belgrade railway project is an important part of China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), connecting Asia with Africa and Europe.

Bendigo and Echuca Line Upgrade, Victoria, Australia

The Bendigo and Echuca line in Victoria, Australia, is undergoing upgrades to provide safer efficient travel in the greater Bendigo region.

Bergen Light Rail System, Norway

The city of Bergen, Norway, is building a light rail system between the centre of the city and Bergen Airport at Flesland.

Berlin Hauptbahnhof and North-South Tunnel

At national reunification in October 1990, Berlin’s rail network and services had undergone years of fragmentation through war damage and political division.

Berlin U-Bahn Upgrading

The city-state of Berlin has a long-established underground network, with the first trains running in 1902. The system h

Bern Urban Rail and Tram Bern West Project, Switzerland

The strength of the cantons in Switzerland's constitution means that Bern has a lower profile than many capital citi

Betuweroute Double-Track Freight Line

The Betuweroute takes its name from a district of the central Netherlands through which it passes. It is a 160km, €

Bhopal Metro Rail Project

Bhopal Metro rail project is a mass rapid transit system (MRTS) being developed in the city of Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India, at an estimated cost of Rs69.41bn ($945m).

Bilbao Metro

A rapid transit railway underground network, the Bilbao Metro is owned and operated by Basque-based Biscay Transport Consortium.

Birmingham Curzon Street Station

Curzon Street station is a planned terminus of the High Speed-2 (HS2) railway network in Birmingham, UK.

Birmingham New Street Station Redevelopment

The Birmingham New Street Station is an important hub and gateway to towns and cities across the UK.

Birmingham Westside Metro Extension, UK

The Birmingham westside metro extension is expected to be completed in the fourth quarter (Q4) of 2021.

Blues Train, Italy

The four-car Blues train can travel at a maximum speed of 160km/h and can accommodate more than 300 seated passengers.

Boca Raton Station, Florida, USA

Brightline’s Boca Raton railway station in Florida, US was opened to the public in December 2022.

Bogibeel Rail Bridge

The Bogibeel rail / road bridge is being built across the River Brahmaputra in the Dibrugarh district, in the state of Assam in north-east India.

Bogota Metro

Bogota Metro Line one, Section one (PLMB) is a 23.96km-long elevated mass rapid transit (MRT) line to be built in Bogota, Columbia.

Bolaños Rail Tunnel

The Bolaños twin-tube rail tunnel is being built on the Madrid-Galicia high-speed line in Spain. The 6.7km-long tunnel is located in the municipality of Castrelo Do Val, approximately 70km away from Orense.

Bombardier Aventra

Bombardier’s Aventra is a modular, easily customisable single-deck train capable of operating in both diesel and electric modes.

Bombardier Flexity Light Rail Vehicles (LRVs)

The Flexity family of light rail vehicles (LRVs) is manufactured by Bombardier Transportation. The LRVs have higher passenger capacity and run at a higher speeds.

Bombardier INNOVIA APM 300

INNOVIA APM 300 is a new-generation automatic people mover designed and manufactured by Bombardier. It is specially designed for flexible operation in both urban and airport transportation.

Bombardier Movia Metro Cars

MOVIA metro cars, which are manufactured by Bombardier Transportation to provide a safe and cost-efficient service, are currently operational in a large number of metro rail networks across the globe.

Bombardier OMNEO (Regio 2N) Double-Deck Train

Bombardier OMNEO is a new electric multiple unit (EMU) double-deck train, that was unveiled in September 2013 by SNCF. The train is marketed as Regio 2N in France.

Bombardier PRIMOVE Light Rail Trams

PRIMOVE Light Rail Trams are designed based on the PRIMOVE Solution from Bombardier. PRIMOVE is a path breaking technology that makes modern urban transport cleaner and more convenient than ever before.

Bombardier Talent 3 Battery Train

Bombardier Talent 3 is a new generation emission-free, battery-powered electric multiple unit (BEMU) manufactured by Bombardier Transportation.

Bombardier TWINDEXX Double-Deck Trains

TWINDEXX is a double-deck train specially designed by Bombardier Transportation for Swiss Federal Railways (SBB). The rolling stock was designed in response to SBB’s proposals to launch an intercity high speed express train.

Bombardier ZEFIRO Very High Speed Trains

The ZEFIRO is the latest class of very high speed (VHS) trains from Bombardier. They are claimed to be the most economic

Bond Street Station, London

Bond Street station is being constructed at New Bond Street, London as part of the Crossrail project. Construction of the new station began in 2011 and is expected to be completed in 2017.

Boston ‘T’ Metro

Commuter lines radiating from Boston's two downtown stations are being extended. The Massachusetts Bay Transportation Au

Boston Green Line Extension (GLX), Massachusetts

The Boston Green Line Extension (GLX) project primarily involves the extension of the Green Line, the oldest light rail transit (LRT) in the US, by a further 4.7 miles (7.56km).

Botany Rail Duplication, New South Wales

Botany rail duplication involves the duplication of 2.9km of freight track of the Botany line rail corridor between Mascot and Botany in New South Wales (NSW), Australia.

Botniabanan High-Speed Railway Line

After several delays including legal challenges, the 190km (118-mile) 1,435mm gauge Botniabanan mixed-use high-speed lin

Brasilia Metro

Brasilia Metro is a two-line rail system that links Brazil's capital Brasília to the satellite cities of the Fede

Braunschweig Tram-Train Scheme

Braunschweig (Brunswick), Germany, is the focal point of a projected tram-train operation covering a large area in the east of Niedersachsen (Lower Saxony).

Bremen Light Rail System

Bremen in north-west Germany is one of the two urban subdivisions, the other being Bremerhaven, that make up the country's smallest land (state), Freie Hansestadt Bremen.

Bremen S Bahn Train Network, Germany

The German S-Bahn format and designation has been widely adopted, including in some other countries. It is popular where

Brenner Base Rail Tunnel

The Brenner Base Tunnel between Austria and Italy will reduce the burden on the road network.

Brent Cross West Station, London

Brent Cross West station is a new station being developed to serve the people of Brent Cross and the northern parts of Cricklewood and Dollis Hill areas of north London, UK.

Brescia Driverless Metro System

The Italian city of Brescia witnessed the opening of a fully automated metro rail system in March 2013. The 13.1km-long driverless metro system connects Prealpino and S. Eufemia Buffalora stations, located respectively at the north and southeast of Brescia.

Bridge and Tunnel Project operated by Danish State Railways

The Great Belt Fixed Link rail and road project, which provides the first physical link between Denmark and Sweden, is amongst the largest ever undertaken in Scandinavia.

Brightline High-Speed Rail Project, Florida

The Brightline high-speed inter-city railway line between Miami and Orlando, Florida, US commenced operations in September 2023.

Brightline West High-Speed Rail Project, USA

Brightline West will build a high-speed passenger rail system between Las Vegas and Southern California by 2028.

Brightline’s Orlando Rail Station, US

Brightline’s Orlando rail station commenced operations in September 2023, with 16 daily round trips departing every hour.

Brisbane Central Station Upgrade

The Central railway station is a major transport hub in the Brisbane central business district (CBD) on the North Coast line in Queensland, Australia. The station is owned and operated by Queensland Rail.

Brisbane Metro, Australia

Brisbane Metro is a new rapid transit system proposed to be constructed in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.

Bristol Tramway

Plans for the Bristol Light Rail System have been shelved with funds for the project to be diverted elsewhere.

Brittany–Loire Valley High-Speed Line

The Brittany - Loire Valley high-speed line, also known as BPL, has been under construction since July 2012. The new high-speed line will be 182km long, connecting the cities of Le Mans and Rennes. The BPL will extend the existing 180km high-speed line between Paris and Connerré, which was built in 1989.

Brno Railway Station, Moravia, Czech Republic

The existing main station in Brno, Czech Republic, will be relocated and provide a range of transportation options.

Brooklyn-Queens Connector (BQX), New York

The Brooklyn-Queens Connector (BQX) is a proposed 26km-long light rail project between Sunset Park in Brooklyn and Astoria in Queens, New York, US. It is intended to provide quality transit-oriented service to under-served areas along the Brooklyn and Queens waterfronts.

Brussels Metro and Tram Network

Public transport in the 19 communes of the Belgian capital and some adjoining areas is operated by STIB/MIVB (Societ

Brussels RER Project in Belgium Including a Infrabel Infrastructure

The Belgian capital of Brussels is also the focal point of the country's densely packed railway network. A high proporti

Bucharest Metro Line 5

Bucharest Metro Line 5 is a new underground subway metro being constructed by Societatea Comercială de Transport c

Bucharest Metrorex, Metro System in Romania

The popularity of metro systems around the globe continues to grow as the demand for reliable high-capacity transport ri

Budapest Border Railway

The MAV (Hungarian Railways) line through the north of the country from Budapest to Hegyeshalom on the main corridor to Vienna has been extensively upgraded, with 86km (53 miles) of the route made suitable for 160km/h operation.

Budapest Metro Four

The Municipality of Budapest and the State Government ordered the construction of a mass transit underground system in early 1998. The project was vigorously examined, and deemed to be the best answer to Budapest's increasing transport problems.

Buenos Aires Metro

Metro construction authority, Subterráneos de Buenos Aires SE (locally called Subte) is expanding the Buenos Aires metro system by adding three new lines, to bring 70% of the population within 400m of a metro station.

Byford Rail Extension, Perth

The Byford rail extension project involves an 8km extension of the Armadale railway line from Armadale train station to the Byford suburb in Perth, Western Australia.

C2 Metro Trains, Munich Underground, Bavaria

The C2 metro trains will be operated on München U-Bahn, the underground rapid transit network of Munich. Munich Public Transportation Company (MVG), a subsidiary of Munich City Utilities (SWM), owns and operates the underground subway network that that serves more than one million passengers a day with a total track length of 100km.

Caen Tramway Project in France Operated by Twisto Transports Urbains

After 12 years of planning and two years of construction, the French town of Caen in Normandy, with 250,000 inhabitants,

CAF Civity Regional Trains, Sweden

CAF Civity is a low-floor train with modular and configurable energy storage systems to operate across European countries.

Cairo Metro

Cairo Metro in Egypt is operated by Egyptian National Railways (ENR) and transported up to 3.5 million passengers per day in 2019.

Cairo Monorail

The 96km Cairo Monorail system with 35 stations will be the world’s longest driverless monorail network.

Calder Valley Rail Line Upgrade, West Yorkshire

Calder Valley line is a two-track railway line running from Manchester Victoria to Leeds in West Yorkshire, UK.

Calgary-Banff Passenger Rail Project, Alberta, Canada

The 150km-long Calgary-Banff passenger rail project is being developed in Alberta, Canada.

California High-Speed Rail Network, US

The California high-speed train project is the first high-speed train system to be implemented in the US.

Cambridge New North Railway Station, Cambridgeshire

Network Rail built the new Cambridge New North railway station in the Chesterton area, north of Cambridge, UK, in collaboration with the Cambridgeshire County Council to create a new transportation hub providing links to routes for cyclists, pedestrians and bus users.

Cambridge South Station, UK

The Cambridge South station will be able to accommodate 1.8 million passengers a year when it becomes operational in 2025.

Canary Wharf Station, London

Canary Wharf station in London will be one of the largest Crossrail stations when completed. The station is expected to serve 25 million passengers a year.

Canberra Light Rail Stage two

The Canberra light rail stage two project is a proposed extension of Canberra’s light rail network from the city centre to Woden in Canberra, Australia.

Capital Metro, Canberra, Australia

The Canberra Metro Stage 1 is a 12km light rail service that connects Gungahlin's northern suburbs to Canberra city centre.

Capital Metro, Texas

On 22 March 2010 a new rapid transit system, Capital Metro, began its operations in Austin, Texas, US. It is the foremos

Capricorn Trains

Capricorn trains are new multiple-units manufactured by Swiss rolling stock manufacturer Stadler Rail. The multiple-unit was unveiled to the public by Stadler and Swiss rail operator Rhaetian Railway (RhB) in April 2019, marking a significant milestone in the development and subsequent operation of the rail vehicle.

Caracas Metro
